\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:module-oabm_tools}}\index{oabm\_tools (module)@\spxentry{oabm\_tools}\spxextra{module}}

\chapter{Open ABM Tools and Utilities}
\label{\detokenize{index:open-abm-tools-and-utilities}}
Open ABM runs on MESA and wraps basic MESA implementations with easy-to-use helper functions.
All current models were built by the MESA team. Users are encouraged to explroe MESA
and its tools after getting started with Open ABM here: \sphinxurl{https://mesa.readthedocs.io/en/master/tutorials/intro\_tutorial.html}

For an interactive introduction, please see our Jupyter notebook walkthrough.
\index{check\_models() (in module oabm\_tools)@\spxentry{check\_models()}\spxextra{in module oabm\_tools}}

Returns a list of strings of valid names one can use with Open ABM’s make() function for building models.

\index{export\_data() (in module oabm\_tools)@\spxentry{export\_data()}\spxextra{in module oabm\_tools}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:oabm_tools.export_data}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{oabm\_tools.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{export\_data}}}{\emph{model}, \emph{agent\_level}, \emph{model\_level}}{}
Exports data associated with the datacollector attribute of a model instance.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} \textendash{} An instance of an Open ABM-supported model / environment

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{agent\_level}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Boolean}}) \textendash{} Tells export\_data whether to return agent-level data

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model\_level}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Boolean}}) \textendash{} Tells export\_data whether to return model-level data

\end{itemize}

\item[{Raises}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{AssertionError}} \textendash{} Model and agent must be Booleans, and must both be specified.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Dataset of model- and/or agent-level data depending on user input

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Pandas Dataframe

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{set\_data\_collection() (in module oabm\_tools)@\spxentry{set\_data\_collection()}\spxextra{in module oabm\_tools}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:oabm_tools.set_data_collection}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{oabm\_tools.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_data\_collection}}}{\emph{model}, \emph{agent\_level}, \emph{model\_level}, \emph{agent\_data\_to\_collect=None}, \emph{model\_data\_to\_collect=None}}{}
Sets the data to be collected by the model for agent and model leveld data.
\begin{quote}

data\_to\_collect can be a dict of string\_names the user chooses and then attributes the user wants, or
it can be string\_names the user chooses and functions of the model that the user wants

Note that if only specifying data collection for agent or model level, then data\_to\_collect automatically fills that slot;
otherwise, user must specify separate dictionary

Also note that this assumes that the given model has a datacollector attribute already!
\end{quote}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} \textendash{} Open ABM supported model instance

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{agent\_level}} \textendash{} Boolean specifying whether to collect agent level data

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model\_level}} \textendash{} Boolean specifying whether to collect model level data

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Updated instance of the model set to collect the requested data.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:module-examples.bank_reserves.bank_reserves.model}}\index{examples.bank\_reserves.bank\_reserves.model (module)@\spxentry{examples.bank\_reserves.bank\_reserves.model}\spxextra{module}}

\chapter{Bank Reserves Model}
\label{\detokenize{index:bank-reserves-model}}
The following code was adapted from the Bank Reserves model included in Netlogo
Model information can be found at: \sphinxurl{http://ccl.northwestern.edu/netlogo/models/BankReserves}
Accessed on: November 2, 2017
Author of NetLogo code:
Wilensky, U. (1998). NetLogo Bank Reserves model.
\sphinxurl{http://ccl.northwestern.edu/netlogo/models/BankReserves}.
Center for Connected Learning and Computer-Based Modeling,
Northwestern University, Evanston, IL.
\index{BankReserves (class in examples.bank\_reserves.bank\_reserves.model)@\spxentry{BankReserves}\spxextra{class in examples.bank\_reserves.bank\_reserves.model}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.bank_reserves.bank_reserves.model.BankReserves}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{examples.bank\_reserves.bank\_reserves.model.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{BankReserves}}}{\emph{height=20}, \emph{width=20}, \emph{init\_people=2}, \emph{rich\_threshold=10}, \emph{reserve\_percent=50}, \emph{server=True}, \emph{num\_steps=100}}{}
This model is a Mesa implementation of the Bank Reserves model from NetLogo.
It is a highly abstracted, simplified model of an economy, with only one
type of agent and a single bank representing all banks in an economy. People
(represented by circles) move randomly within the grid. If two or more people
are on the same grid location, there is a 50\% chance that they will trade with
each other. If they trade, there is an equal chance of giving the other agent
\$5 or \$2. A positive trade balance will be deposited in the bank as savings.
If trading results in a negative balance, the agent will try to withdraw from
its savings to cover the balance. If it does not have enough savings to cover
the negative balance, it will take out a loan from the bank to cover the
difference. The bank is required to keep a certain percentage of deposits as
reserves and the bank’s ability to loan at any given time is a function of
the amount of deposits, its reserves, and its current total outstanding loan
amount.
\index{grid\_w (examples.bank\_reserves.bank\_reserves.model.BankReserves attribute)@\spxentry{grid\_w}\spxextra{examples.bank\_reserves.bank\_reserves.model.BankReserves attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.bank_reserves.bank_reserves.model.BankReserves.grid_w}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{grid\_w}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ = 20}}}
init parameters “init\_people”, “rich\_threshold”, and “reserve\_percent”
are all UserSettableParameters

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.boid_flockers.boid_flockers.boid.Boid}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{examples.boid\_flockers.boid\_flockers.boid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Boid}}}{\emph{unique\_id}, \emph{model}, \emph{pos}, \emph{speed}, \emph{velocity}, \emph{vision}, \emph{separation}, \emph{cohere=0.025}, \emph{separate=0.25}, \emph{match=0.04}}{}
A Boid-style flocker agent.
\begin{description}
\item[{The agent follows three behaviors to flock:}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Cohesion: steering towards neighboring agents.

\item {} 
Separation: avoiding getting too close to any other agent.

\item {} 
Alignment: try to fly in the same direction as the neighbors.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

Boids have a vision that defines the radius in which they look for their
neighbors to flock with. Their speed (a scalar) and velocity (a vector)
define their movement. Separation is their desired minimum distance from
any other Boid.
\index{cohere() (examples.boid\_flockers.boid\_flockers.boid.Boid method)@\spxentry{cohere()}\spxextra{examples.boid\_flockers.boid\_flockers.boid.Boid method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.boid_flockers.boid_flockers.boid.Boid.cohere}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{cohere}}}{\emph{neighbors}}{}
Return the vector toward the center of mass of the local neighbors.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{match\_heading() (examples.boid\_flockers.boid\_flockers.boid.Boid method)@\spxentry{match\_heading()}\spxextra{examples.boid\_flockers.boid\_flockers.boid.Boid method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.boid_flockers.boid_flockers.boid.Boid.match_heading}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{match\_heading}}}{\emph{neighbors}}{}
Return a vector of the neighbors’ average heading.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{separate() (examples.boid\_flockers.boid\_flockers.boid.Boid method)@\spxentry{separate()}\spxextra{examples.boid\_flockers.boid\_flockers.boid.Boid method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.boid_flockers.boid_flockers.boid.Boid.separate}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{separate}}}{\emph{neighbors}}{}
Return a vector away from any neighbors closer than separation dist.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{step() (examples.boid\_flockers.boid\_flockers.boid.Boid method)@\spxentry{step()}\spxextra{examples.boid\_flockers.boid\_flockers.boid.Boid method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.boid_flockers.boid_flockers.boid.Boid.step}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{step}}}{}{}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{Boltzmann Wealth Model}
\label{\detokenize{index:boltzmann-wealth-model}}
This example created by MESA’s team
\index{BoltzmannWealthModel (class in examples.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.model)@\spxentry{BoltzmannWealthModel}\spxextra{class in examples.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.model}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.boltzmann_wealth_model.boltzmann_wealth_model.model.BoltzmannWealthModel}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{examples.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.model.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{BoltzmannWealthModel}}}{\emph{N=100}, \emph{width=10}, \emph{height=10}, \emph{num\_steps=1000}, \emph{server=True}}{}
A simple model of an economy where agents exchange currency at random.

All the agents begin with one unit of currency, and each time step can give
a unit of currency to another agent. Note how, over time, this produces a
highly skewed distribution of wealth.
\index{run\_model() (examples.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.model.BoltzmannWealthModel method)@\spxentry{run\_model()}\spxextra{examples.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.boltzmann\_wealth\_model.model.BoltzmannWealthModel method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.conways_game_of_life.conways_game_of_life.cell.Cell}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{examples.conways\_game\_of\_life.conways\_game\_of\_life.cell.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Cell}}}{\emph{pos}, \emph{model}, \emph{init\_state=0}}{}

\index{advance() (examples.conways\_game\_of\_life.conways\_game\_of\_life.cell.Cell method)@\spxentry{advance()}\spxextra{examples.conways\_game\_of\_life.conways\_game\_of\_life.cell.Cell method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{step() (examples.conways\_game\_of\_life.conways\_game\_of\_life.cell.Cell method)@\spxentry{step()}\spxextra{examples.conways\_game\_of\_life.conways\_game\_of\_life.cell.Cell method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.conways_game_of_life.conways_game_of_life.cell.Cell.step}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{step}}}{}{}
Compute if the cell will be dead or alive at the next tick.  This is
based on the number of alive or dead neighbors.  The state is not
changed here, but is just computed and stored in self.\_nextState,
because our current state may still be necessary for our neighbors
to calculate their next state.

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:module-examples.conways_game_of_life.conways_game_of_life.model}}\index{examples.conways\_game\_of\_life.conways\_game\_of\_life.model (module)@\spxentry{examples.conways\_game\_of\_life.conways\_game\_of\_life.model}\spxextra{module}}

\chapter{Conways Game of Life Model}
\label{\detokenize{index:conways-game-of-life-model}}
This example created by MESA’s team.

\begin{fulllineitems}

This example created by MESA’s team.
\index{EpsteinCivilViolence (class in examples.epstein\_civil\_violence.epstein\_civil\_violence.model)@\spxentry{EpsteinCivilViolence}\spxextra{class in examples.epstein\_civil\_violence.epstein\_civil\_violence.model}}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.epstein_civil_violence.epstein_civil_violence.model.EpsteinCivilViolence}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{examples.epstein\_civil\_violence.epstein\_civil\_violence.model.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{EpsteinCivilViolence}}}{\emph{height=40}, \emph{width=40}, \emph{citizen\_density=0.7}, \emph{cop\_density=0.074}, \emph{citizen\_vision=7}, \emph{cop\_vision=7}, \emph{legitimacy=0.8}, \emph{max\_jail\_term=1000}, \emph{active\_threshold=0.1}, \emph{arrest\_prob\_constant=2.3}, \emph{movement=True}, \emph{max\_iters=1000}, \emph{server=True}, \emph{num\_steps=1000}}{}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.hex_snowflake.hex_snowflake.cell.Cell}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{examples.hex\_snowflake.hex\_snowflake.cell.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Cell}}}{\emph{pos}, \emph{model}, \emph{init\_state=0}}{}

\index{advance() (examples.hex\_snowflake.hex\_snowflake.cell.Cell method)@\spxentry{advance()}\spxextra{examples.hex\_snowflake.hex\_snowflake.cell.Cell method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Set the state to the new computed state \textendash{} computed in step().

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{step() (examples.hex\_snowflake.hex\_snowflake.cell.Cell method)@\spxentry{step()}\spxextra{examples.hex\_snowflake.hex\_snowflake.cell.Cell method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.hex_snowflake.hex_snowflake.cell.Cell.step}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{step}}}{}{}
Compute if the cell will be dead or alive at the next tick. A dead
cell will become alive if it has only one neighbor. The state is not
changed here, but is just computed and stored in self.\_nextState,
because our current state may still be necessary for our neighbors
to calculate their next state.
When a cell is made alive, its neighbors are able to be considered in the next step. Only cells that are considered check their neighbors for performance reasons.

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:module-examples.hex_snowflake.hex_snowflake.model}}\index{examples.hex\_snowflake.hex\_snowflake.model (module)@\spxentry{examples.hex\_snowflake.hex\_snowflake.model}\spxextra{module}}

Northwestern University, Evanston, IL.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:module-examples.sugarscape_cg.sugarscape_cg.schedule}}\index{examples.sugarscape\_cg.sugarscape\_cg.schedule (module)@\spxentry{examples.sugarscape\_cg.sugarscape\_cg.schedule}\spxextra{module}}\index{RandomActivationByBreed (class in examples.sugarscape\_cg.sugarscape\_cg.schedule)@\spxentry{RandomActivationByBreed}\spxextra{class in examples.sugarscape\_cg.sugarscape\_cg.schedule}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:examples.sugarscape_cg.sugarscape_cg.schedule.RandomActivationByBreed}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{examples.sugarscape\_cg.sugarscape\_cg.schedule.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{RandomActivationByBreed}}}{\emph{model}}{}
A scheduler which activates each type of agent once per step, in random
order, with the order reshuffled every step.

This is equivalent to the NetLogo ‘ask breed…’ and is generally the
default behavior for an ABM.

Assumes that all agents have a step() method.
\index{add() (examples.sugarscape\_cg.sugarscape\_cg.schedule.RandomActivationByBreed method)@\spxentry{add()}\spxextra{examples.sugarscape\_cg.sugarscape\_cg.schedule.RandomActivationByBreed method}}
